Â© DeA Picture Library / Art Resource, NY

The ancient Korean gold and jade crown shown was likely intended to communicate the power of its wearer through the inclusion of

choices.label: rectilinear elements that symbolize the strength and stability provided by an ideal ruler
natural imagery resembling plant and animal forms that are important in shamanism
metallic forms resembling weapons and shields, important in a military society
curving elements that signify maternal qualities emphasized in a matriarchal society

unit.text: 8: South, East, and Southeast Asia, 300 BCE - 1980 CE

topic.text: 8.2: Purpose and Audience in South, East, and Southeast Asian Art

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain how the possible intent, purpose, and/or function shape the creation or meaning of a work of art (or group of related works of art).
